required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Singapore Tele-technology Aided Rehabilitation in Stroke (STARS) Study
clinical_study.official_title: The Singapore Tele-technology Aided Rehabilitation in Stroke (STARS) Study: A Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Ang Mo Kio Thye Hua Kwan Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary hypothesis tested in this randomized control trial is that a tele-rehabilitation intervention involving video-conferencing with a therapist and use of wearable monitoring devices in the first three months after stroke results greater functional recovery using the Jette Late Life Functional and Disability Instrument (LLFDI) (primary outcome) among stroke at three months survivors compared to usual care.
The secondary hypotheses tested in this randomized control trial are that a tele-rehabilitation intervention involving video-conferencing with a therapist and use of wearable monitoring devices in the first three months after stroke results in:
- Functional recovery using the LLFDI at 6 months,
- Functional recovery using gait speed, 2-minute walk test and Shah modified Barthel Index at 3 and 6 months,
- Greater contact time with a therapist at 3 & 6 months,
- Better balance at 3 & 6 months,
- Better self-report health-related quality of life at 3 & 6 months,
- Decreased health service utilization at 3 & 6 months,
- Reduced caregiver burden at three months survivors compared to usual care at 3 & 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Jette Late Life Functional and Disability Instrument (LLFDI)
primary_outcome.description: Disability component of the Jette Late Life Functional and Disability Instrument (LLFDI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Jette Late Life Functional and Disability Instrument (LLFDI)
secondary_outcome.description: Disabiity component of Jette Late Life Functional and Disability Instrument (LLFDI)

other_outcome.measure: Self-reported health-related quality-of-life using the Euro-QOL (EQ-5D)
other_outcome.description: Self-reported health-related quality-of-life using the Euro-QOL (EQ-5D)

other_outcome.measure: Health service utilization (perform cost-effectiveness analyses) using the Singapore Stroke Study Health Service Utilization Form
other_outcome.description: Health service utilization (perform cost-effectiveness analyses) using the Singapore Stroke Study Health Service Utilization Form

other_outcome.measure: Caregiver reported stress using the Zarit Caregiver Burden Inventory
other_outcome.description: Caregiver reported stress using the Zarit Caregiver Burden Inventory

arm_group.description: A tele-rehabilitation intervention involving weekly video-conferencing with a therapist, training exercise videos and use of wearable sensors to capture patient participation in exercises.

facility.name: Ang Mo Kio Thye Hua Kwan Hospital

link.description: Ang Mo Kio Thye Hua Kwan Hospital

reference.citation: Duncan PW, Sullivan KJ, Behrman AL, Azen SP, Wu SS, Nadeau SE, Dobkin BH, Rose DK, Tilson JK, Cen S, Hayden SK; LEAPS Investigative Team. Body-weight-supported treadmill rehabilitation after stroke. N Engl J Med. 2011 May 26;364(21):2026-36. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa1010790.

Duncan PW, Sullivan KJ, Behrman AL, Azen SP, Wu SS, Nadeau SE, Dobkin BH, Rose DK, Tilson JK; LEAPS Investigative Team. Protocol for the Locomotor Experience Applied Post-stroke (LEAPS) trial: a randomized controlled trial. BMC Neurol. 2007 Nov 8;7:39.

Chumbler NR, Quigley P, Li X, Morey M, Rose D, Sanford J, Griffiths P, Hoenig H. Effects of telerehabilitation on physical function and disability for stroke patients: a randomized, controlled trial. Stroke. 2012 Aug;43(8):2168-74. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.111.646943. Epub 2012 May 24.
